summary: Email correspondence between an FBI Special Agent and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding phone record service providers for several phone numbers associated with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell during an investigation. The document reveals law enforcement efforts to obtain telecommunications data.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York VCAC/Human Trafficking
persons.context: FBI agent from the New York Violent Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking unit corresponding about phone record service providers for numbers linked to Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: AUSA from SDNY requesting information on phone service providers for specific phone numbers as part of the investigation.

connections.person1: Special Agent FBI New York VCAC/Human Trafficking
connections.person2: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Law enforcement agent and federal prosecutor coordinating on obtaining phone record information for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Phone Records Inquiry
events.description: Email exchange between FBI agent and AUSA regarding service providers for phone numbers associated with Epstein and Maxwell.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York VCAC/Human Trafficking
Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively investigating phone records associated with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell as of May 2019.
The investigation involved the FBI's Violent Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking unit in New York.
Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were coordinating with FBI agents to obtain telecommunications data.
Phone numbers included references to Epstein's New York office and Maxwell's cell phone.
Service providers mentioned include T-Mobile, AT&T, and Verizon.
